conclusion: Analyze the motion of the particle in the two magnetic fields B1 and B2.
The particle enters the magnetic field B1 perpendicularly at point O.
The particle starts to move in a circular path due to the magnetic force.
The radius of the circular motion in B1 is r1 = mv/qB1.
The time period for one complete revolution in B1 is T1 = 2πm/qB1.
When the particle leaves B1 and enters B2, it continues to move in a circular path with a different radius.
The radius in B2 is r2 = mv/qB2.
Given B1 = 2B2, r2 can be expressed as 2r1.
The time period for one complete revolution in B2 is T2 = 4πm/qB1.
To return to point O downward, the particle must complete half a revolution in both B1 and B2.
The time taken to complete half a revolution in B1 is πm/qB1.
The time taken to complete half a revolution in B2 is 2πm/qB1.
The total time to complete half revolutions in both fields and return to O downward is t_total = 3πm/qB1.
The particle will pass through point O downward again after a time t = 3πm/qB1.
